answers.answer: I'm sorry you're having such a hard time.  We had huge problems with our daughter binge eating at night and not bolusing (she's on a pump).  She decided to take all her problems and answer them with food and wanted to pretend she didn't have diabetes.  This was when she was 15.  I almost wanted to rip my hair out because I couldn't figure out why her #'s were so high! Finally, I compared her meter to her log.  They didn't match at all.  The diabetes educator had mentioned we should have done that before but I believed my daughter when she said her numbers were correct.  Boy was I wrong... I'm not saying that this is what is going on with your daughter, but only to let you know that teenagers are just that... Teenagers.  My daughter has had diabetes for 10 years and dealt with it better as a 7 year old than she does now.  As for your Dr., I had to fight for a new one also.  I know how you feel.  Good luck!

question: My daughter has been a type 1 for 16 months we have had no luck in getting her under control.  Recently we have been able to keep her day numbers in anormal range but she still gets up over 350 daily.  She can go to bed at 100 and get up at 450 she is nauseous and missing school until her novalog kicks in and then her numbers stay good trhoughout the day.  She is on a long acting at night and in the morning the doc has tried increasing and adding nph at bedtime but she still goes high - it is at 330-345 daily we found on her continous monitor-.  Right now her doctor jsut cant figure it out and is certain she is not doing her shots at bedtime.  My husband and I both supervise her shots but her doctor says that is he only answer since shes a teenager she must be skipping them.  Our diabetic nurse thinks its Dawn Phenomenon but the doctor says since we have gone from 20 - 26 now on her bedtime it cant be becasue it hasnt made a bit of difference.  If anyone has had this problem or can offer suggestions on what to try next we would really be grateful. We are in the process of fighting Kaiser for a new endo that will work with us but it is a battle and I just want to help my child be a kid again.  Thanks
title: Extreme Morning HIghs
